title: US unemployment rate drops to 5.6%, but wages fall â business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: niesr : uk economy grew by 0.6 % in q4
ap : job creation strong , but wage growth weak .
us unemployment rate hits new six-year low .

text: european stock market have just closed , with chunky losses across the board .
the french cac and german dax both fell by 2.2 % , with traders worrying about this morning 's weak industrial production data from both countries and the drop in german exports .
the spanish ibex tumbled over 5 % , partly due to santander dropping 10 % after a capital raising exercise last night .
the italian ftse mib lost 3.4 % , in a nervous end to the week .
there 's also disappointment that the ecb is reportedly only considering a ¬500bn stimulus programme .
in london , the ftse 100 shed 68 points or 1.05 % to 6501 .
and that 's probably all for today , although i may pop back if any big news breaks this evening ( assuming i can get online ) .
otherwise , good night , and have a good weekend .
gw
the oil price is falling too .
brent crude just fell below the $ 49 per barrel mark for the first time since mid-2009 .
stock markets are ending the week in the red .
the european indices are all down , led by france where the cac has shed 1.75 % .
in london , the ftse 100 is down 60 points or 0.9 % , and shares are down on wall street too : cnbc now ( @ cnbcnow ) alert : dow down 175 points â »

documents.title: read the full story here
text: from new york , my colleague jana kasperkevic has the full story on america 's jobs report : the us economy appeared to be improving as the country added 252,000 jobs in december , with the unemployment rate dropping to 5.6 % .
the number of unemployed americans declined by 383,000 , which still leaves about 8.7 million people out of work .
december 's job report exceeded expectations .
economists expected the bureau of labor statistics to report growth of 240,000 in december , making the 2014 gains largest since 1999 .
over the year , the job growth averaged 246,000 jobs a month a significant jump compared to 194,000 in 2013 .
the unusual warm-yet-snowy december meant that weather did not have much impact on the jobs numbers , according to goldman sachs analysts .
while job growth saw positive gains , pay is not improving .
average hourly earnings took a hit , decreasing by 5 cents in december , following a 6 cent increase in november .
more here : us adds 252,000 jobs in december amid improving employment outlook
reaction to the us jobs report keeps flooding in .

david lamb , senior dealer at the foreign exchange specialists fexco , says america is outpacing the rest of the global economy : if this recovery does n't run out of steam , the fed will come under increasing pressure to hike interest rates sooner rather than later .
it may only be concerns over the global that stops it from considering imminent rate rises .
kully samra at charles schwab in london agrees : at the moment the u.s. is the only party on the street .
where else are you going to go for growth .
joseph brusuelas , chief economist at mcgladrey , suggests wages will up soon .
joseph brusuelas ( @ joebrusuelas ) it 's important to recall that wages tend to lag job gains .
i think that there are seasonal issues at play with avg hourly earnings est .
over in greece , the left-wing syriza party is holding a steady lead in the opinion polls , with just over two weeks to go to the general election .
a new poll , being published by the parapolitika newspaper , shows syriza leading with 34.1 % of support followed by the ( currently ) ruling new democracy party with 30 % .

documents.title: niesr : uk economy grew by 0.6 % in q4
text: back in britain , the niesr thinktank has just estimated that uk gdp grew by 0.6 % in the final three months of 2014 .
that 's a slight slowdown , but still pretty solid.. that would mean that the uk economy grew by 2.6 % during the last year - the best year since 2007 .
it could also be the fastest growth in the g8 .
in theory , wages should rise as the unemployment rate falls , as employers are pushed to offer higher earnings to attract and retain staff .
but this is n't happening , either in the us or in britain .

economists are struggling to adapt to this new environment , as marcus bullus , trading director of mb capital , explains : wages going into reverse while the economy and job levels improve is verging on the freakonomic .
the mixed signals in this data make it really difficult for the markets to digest .
more jobs than expected in december , and big upward revisions in october and november , but pay packets remain under pressure .
2014 may have been the best year for jobs since 1999 , but it 's also the year in which the employment market went off-piste .
we 're dealing with an economics that few economists recognise .

wage anomalies aside , this is nevertheless a solid figure that we can at least enjoy without worrying about an interest rate rise.all in all , this is as good a start to 2015 as we could probably have hoped for .

paul dales of capital economics reckons the federal reserve could ignore the weak wage growth , given the steady job creation : overall , there has been a clear acceleration in job growth since last summer , a faster decline in the unemployment rate , but few signs of faster wage growth .
if the activity data continue to improve , as we expect , then the fed may not wait for wage growth to rise and could still raise rates as soon as march .
it 's certainly possible .
but do n't forget that america 's inflation rate has just fallen by the most in six years .
not the best environment to be tightening monetary policy
mohamed el-erian , chief economic adviser at allianz , is optimistic that wages will rise in the months ahead as the us economy improves .
mohamed a. el-erian ( @ elerianm ) solid dec # jobs creation caps strong empl year.wage growth disappointing but , given other components of report , this will also gradually turn
if you ignore the monthly fall in wages , then this is a great jobs report , says marketwatch .
marketwatch ( @ marketwatch ) amazing ' jobs report , apart from wages , economists say : not that simple , alas , for millions of lower-paid americans .
tanweer akram of voya investment management reckons the federal reserve is still on track to raise interest rates in the middle of this year .
he says : job gains were fairly widespread and occurred in professional and business services , construction , food services , health care , and manufacturing industries .
akram also explains that wage growth was low because most jobs growth is still occurring in low wage industries .
that means earnings are barely outstripping inflation .
average hourly earnings rose just 1.7 % over the past 12 months , while cpi-u inflation increased by 1.3 % between nov 2013 and nov 2014 .

documents.title: ing : a mixed report
text: there 's something for everyone in today 's jobs report , says rob carnell of ing .
on the upside : more people than expected were hired in december , and revisions to old date added another 50,000 new jobs .

on the downside , the 0.2 % drop in hourly earnings is a real disappointment , carnell explains : if you want to raise rates , these numbers provide the ammunition you need in terms of payrolls and the unemployment rate .
historically , the fed always thought full employment was at about a 5.3 % rate .
so we are insignificantly higher than that now .
the rate of payrolls jobs growth is also lending weight to the hikers arguments .

against this , with even less wage inflation than was apparent last month , the doves can argue that the unemployment figures are biased and giving a misleading steer , and argue against any near-term increase in rates .
ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) better than expected us jobs figure confirms 2014 as best year for job creation since 1999 # nfp # usa
the us dollar has been volatile , as traders try to interpret today 's jobs report .
lydia idem finkley ( @ faithmight ) while the jobs report was strong , 0 wage growth = 0 rate increases .
that 's why the usd is so confused .

documents.title: ap : job creation strong , but wage growth weak
text: here 's associated press 's early take on the non-farm payroll : the u.s. capped its best year for hiring in 15 years with a healthy job gain in december and the unemployment rate falling to a six-year low .
the data adds to signs of strength that contrast with sputtering global growth .
the labor department says employers added 252,000 jobs last month and 50,000 more in october and november combined than previously estimated .
the unemployment rate dropped to 5.6 percent from 5.8 percent and is at the lowest level since june 2008 .
yet wage growth remains weak .
average hourly pay slipped 5 cents .
and the unemployment rate fell partly because many of the unemployed gave up looking for work .
the government does n't count people as unemployed if they are n't searching for jobs .

documents.title: non-farm payroll : instant reaction
text: bloomberg economist carl riccadonna points out that the fall in the jobless rate is partly because more americans quit the labour force : carl riccadonna ( @ riccanomix ) this is a `` hollow '' decline in the unemployment rate due to falling participation this will not make yellen nervous of an overheat .
professor justin wolfers is worried by the lack of wage growth : justin wolfers ( @ justinwolfers ) last month 's bump in hourly earnings ( +0.4 % ) was revised down to 0.2 % .
and this month saw a 0.2 % fall in hourly earnings .
no wage inflation .
city index 's ashraf laidi suggests the federal reserve wo n't feel more pressure to raise interest rates .

ashraf laidi ( @ alaidi ) quick interpretation : unemloyment drop helped by falling participation rate but negative avg hrly earnings means fed not in hurry to hike and michael strain of american enterprise institute sees more spare capacity in the us economy : michael r. strain ( @ michaelrstrain ) dear fed : this is a great report .
but most of the measures of slack did n't change , so no surprise that we are n't seeing wage inflation .

healthcare , manufacturing , transportation and food services firms all expanded their workforces last month : dan diamond ( @ ddiamond ) today 's emoji jobs report ð¥ - added 34,100 jobs ð­ - added 17,000 jobs ð - added 7,300 jobs ðð » - added 43,600 jobs overall report : ðð
today 's non-farm payroll shows that america has created more jobs in 2014 than in any year since 1999 .
nick timiraos ( @ nicktimiraos ) the us added more jobs last year than any since 1999 most jobs over 12-month period since 2000
this is n't a good sign .
the labour force participation rate has dropped , to 62.7 % , from 62.9 % in november .
that means more many working age americans dropped out of the workforce .

documents.title: us wages fall by 0.2 %
text: but there 's some bad news too .
average earnings paid to us workers fell by 0.2 % in december , dashing hopes of a 0.2 % rise .
year-on-year , wages are only up by 1.7 % .
that 's disappointing , showing that the recovery is n't feeding into workers ' wallets .
more people are getting jobs , but they 're not getting the pay rises needed .
neil irwin ( @ neil irwin ) average hourly earnings -0.2 % , which is quite disappointing .
marketwatch economy ( @ mktweconomics ) average hourly wages fell 0.2 % , lowering the 12-month increase to just 1.7 % , the labor department said friday .
more jobs were created in november than expected .
the bureau of labor statistics now says that 353,000 new employees were taken on , up from 321,000 initially expected .
and october 's reading has been revised up to 261,000 , up from 243,000 .

documents.title: us unemployment rate hits new six-year low
text: the us unemployment rate has fallen to 5.6 % , the lowest rate since june 2008 .
breaking : the us economy created 252,000 new jobs in december .
more than expected , showing american firms continue to hire staff .

documents.title: us unemployment , a preamble
text: nearly time for the last major economic news of the week - america 's employment report for december .
the non-farm payroll will show the latest us unemployment rate , how many new jobs were created last month , and whether wages rose during the month .
economists reckon the nfp will rise by around 240,000 .
but there 's also the possibility that november and october 's data will be revised .
ross finley ( @ rossfinley ) u.s. dec # nfp @ twitterid forecast 240k ( 321k nov ) .
range 168-305k .
7/10 best recent f'casters are below consensus a strong reading would be good news for the us economy , but might raise the chance of an early interest rate rise .
that , though , would also be dependent on rising earnings it 's due at 8.30am washington time , or 1.30pm in the uk

documents.title: lunchtime summary
text: a quick recap .
the european central bank is inching closer to launching a new stimulus programme .
staff have presented various options to the ecb 's governing council , ahead of the meeting in two weeks time .
according to bloomberg , the programme could expand the ecb 's balance sheet by ¬500bn .
financial analysts are sceptical that this would be enough , though .
ecb sources have told reuters that there 's a stronger consensus that a quantitative easing programme is needed .
the latest economic data have shown the need for fresh stimulus .
german exports and industrial production both fell in november , and france also suffered a decline in factory output .
and the uk 's trade gap has narrowed , thanks to cheaper oil .
there 's a possibility that russia could be downgraded later today , to junk status .
as it 's friday , the main credit rating agencies will be publishing their latest decisions on several countries , including germany , portugal and russia .

rating decisions olga budovnits , credit analyst at union bancaire privee , reckons a downgrade is highly likely given russia 's currency crierir budovnits told bloomberg that : there were massive and rapid changes to russia 's economic outlook in the last three months , driven by oil prices .
this has caused a massive ruble devaluation , inflation and reduced access to credit .
the wsj has a handy calendar of rating decisions here .

documents.title: reuters : consensus for ecb qe has grown
text: reuters has just published its own report on the ecb 's meeting this week , with a different take than bloomberg .

here 's the top lines : the european central bank is considering a dual approach to government bond purchases which would involve both it buying debt and sharing the risk across the euro zone and , in a nod to german qualms , separate purchases by national central banks .

sources familiar with the discussions said such a bond-buying option , also known as quantitative easing ( qe ) , is among the tools the ecb is preparing ahead of its jan. 22 policy meeting should it decide to act to address falling consumer prices and a growing risk of deflation in the euro zone .
several qe plans are under discussion and nothing has been decided so far .

but the debate reflects the ecb 's efforts to build a robust programme that meets german concerns about how much it would take of the risk yet convinces investors anticipating an unlimited money-printing pledge .
markets and many economists believe anything short of an unlimited money-printing pledge will fail to revive a moribund euro zone economy .
the ecb governing council discussed the situation at a dinner on wednesday night as it gathered for a regular non-policy meeting .
one central bank source said there was clearly more of a consensus than before that qe might be necessary .
on the rest , there are still pretty much divergent views on the whole range of issues - volume , open-ended or closed , risk sharing or not , whether there are contingencies and which ones .
it 's still very open , the source said .

another central bank source said one of the options that was discussed was one where the ecb would buy a certain share of the total programme and in case of default the risk would be shared among national central banks depending on their capital share .
the remaining part of the programme 's volume would be bought by national central banks , but at their own risk .
there was no fundamental opposition against this option on wednesday , said the source .
this could be an option , which the bundesbank could go along with .
but the source said there was no decision yet and the discussion remained very much open .
this is one option that is being discussed and it may go in this direction , but nothing has been decided , the source said .
ioan smith ( @ moved average ) reuters turn # ecb considers dual qe approach that involves ecb buying govt bonds w/ez risk-sharing and ncbs buying at own risk -sources

documents.title: shares dip after qe report
text: european stock markets have dropped since bloomberg reported that the ecb is considering launching a ¬500bn stimulus programme .
the ftse 100 , german dax and french cac are all down around 0.5 % .
another sign that the plan might underwhelm investors .
jonathan ferro ( @ ferrotv ) ecb bond plan in theory .
qe well flagged .
¬500bn widely expected .
but investment grade only is the perfect way to side-step the greek issue !

bloomberg has also concluded that a ¬500bn stimulus programme would n't be enough to drag the eurozone away from deflation : michael mcdonough ( @ m mcdonough ) ecb 's qe plan too small to arrest inflation decline : by @ twitterid24 & @ twitterid { nsn nhwos86jijuq < go > }
portuguese government debt could also be excluded from the ecb 's new qe programme if it decides to only buy investment-grade bonds , as it has a junk ' rating .
nick kounis ( @ nickkounis ) # ecb considering eur 500bn investment grade sovereign qe plan .
this means greece but also portugal could be excluded from qe .
a ¬500bn qe programme would not be enough , on its own , to swell the ecb 's balance sheet towards its levels in 2012 when it topped ¬3trillion .
that 's mario draghi 's stated goal - although several members of the ecb 's executive council refused to back him last month .
holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) # ecb said to study bond-purchase models up to ¬500bn to boost balance sheet .
worth noting that many investors are dubious that a qe programme would do much good .
macrocredit ( @ macrocredit ) ecb readies ¬500bn qe , but 51 % investors we polled think it will work only in financial markets .
eu govts must do more on stimulus , reforms

some analysts are cautioning that a ¬500bn quantitative easing programme would n't give europe 's economy enough of a jolt : michael hewson ( @ mhewson cmc ) so potentially ¬500bn of investment grade qe coming - that 's a gnat bite really - hard to see how that will help # euro world first ( @ world first ) euro rallies a slice on eu500bn invt grade qe chatter .
half a trillion is towards the lower end of expectations ( as strange as that sounds ) sony kapoor ( @ sonykapoor ) important but not enough ! ! !
bloomberg breaking news : ecb staff said to have outlined $ 590 billion investment-grade qe plan

documents.title: bloomberg : ecb looking at ¬500bn qe plan
text: the new ecb headquarters in frankfurt .
pfaffenbach/reuters the european central bank is considering a new ¬500bn quantitative easing programme to stimulate the ailing european economy , according to a story just published by bloomberg .
it says that staff at the ecb presented the proposal to the governing council this week .
no decision has been taken yet .
under the plan , the ecb would buy investment grade ' assets only , which would rule out sovereign debt issued by greece , for example .
that might allow the ecb to unveil the plan at its january 22 meeting , even though the greek general election is three days later .

the story is online here : ecb said to study bond-purchase models up to 500 billion euros here 's a flavour : european central bank staff presented policy makers with models for buying as much as ¬500bn ( $ 591bn ) of investment-grade assets , according to a person who attended a meeting of the governing council .
various quantitative-easing options were shown to governors on january 7 in frankfurt , including buying only aaa-rated debt or bonds rated at least bbb- , the euro-area central bank official said .
governors took no decision on the design or implementation of any package after the presentation , according to the person and another official who attended the meeting .
the people asked not to be identified because the deliberations were private .
a 500 billion-euro purchase program would take the ecb halfway toward its goal of boosting its balance sheet to avert a deflationary spiral in the euro area .
the institution is also buying asset-backed securities and covered bonds , and government bond-buying would be part of fresh stimulus to be considered at the governing council 's january 22 meeting .
francine lacqua ( @ flacqua ) # ecb scoop : treatment of junk-rated debt such as greek bonds not addressed in presentation reaction to follow

documents.title: uk 's trade deficit with germany hits record
text: here 's an interesting factoid from today 's trade data .
the uk has recorded its largest ever trade in goods deficit with germany , at â£ 7.8bn in the september-november quarter .
that is due to a drop in exports , and a slight increase in imports , the ons said .
the report ( online here ) also shows that the uk 's deficit on trade in goods with non-eu countries shrank by â£ 900m .
the deficit with eu countries only fell by â£ 100m , though .
uk trade data , november 2014

documents.title: oil slide narrows uk trade gap
text: the largest container ship in world , cscl globe , docking at the port of felixstowe in south east england on wednesday .
melville/reuters britain 's trade gap has shrunk , mainly thanks to the recent tumble in the oil price .
the uk 's deficit on trade in goods and services with the rest of the world fell to â£ 1.4bn in november 2014 , down from â£ 2.2 billion in october 2014 .
britain imported â£ 8.8bn more goods than it exported , but also made a â£ 7.4bn surplus on services .
the amount of oil imported fell by â£ 700m during the month , the ons said , meaning the drop in the cost of crude oil is having a beneficial effect .
uk trade gap , to november 2014

documents.title: uk manufacturing beats forecasts
text: britain 's manufacturers have just posted their strongest monthly growth since april .
manufacturing output across the uk rose by 0.7 % in november , and was 2.7 % higher than a year ago .
the office for national statistics says transport equipment , and basic metals & metal product manufacturing , drove the increase .
shaun richards ( @ notayesmansecon ) better news !
manufacturing output increased by 0.7 % between october 2014 and november 2014 .
# gbp but the wider measure of industrial output fell , by 0.1 % , due to a big drop in oil and gas production as north sea oil rigs went offline for maintenance .
this chart from german stats body destatis shows how the country has steadily run a trade surplus over the last two years .
german exports there are more details here .
the financial markets have not been spooked by the german and french data .
the ftse , dax and cac indices are all broadly flat , while the euro is hovering just over $ 1.18 , near a nine-year low .
the markets are still being driven by expectations that the european central bank will launch a new quantitative easing programme , perhaps this month .
today 's signs of factory weakness should n't make that any less likely .
the economist intelligence unit is also concerned by the french economy : the eiu europe ( @ theeiu europe ) french industrial production down 0.3 % mom and 2.6 % yoy in november .
significantly worse than expected .
this chart , from stats body insee , also shows how france 's factories have been lagging for several years : french industrial production
the drop in french industrial production may indicate that the economy shrank at the end of last year , warns analysts at bnp paribas bank .
chris whittall ( @ chris whittall ) bnp paribas sees risk of negative french gdp growth in q4 following poor manufacturing and industrial production data

documents.title: first private nhs hospital provider circle throws in towel
text: the big uk business news this morning is that healthcare company circle has announced plans to pull out of its contract to manage britain 's first privately run nhs hospital .
circle blamed funding cuts , and a surge in demand for a & e services , for the decision to walk away .

the move comes as britain 's hospitals are gripped by the biggest emergency care crisis in years ; the future of the uk health service will be a major issue in the run-up to may 's general election : here 's sean farrell 's full story : circle in talks to exit private contract to run hinchingbrooke some reaction : kevin maguire ( @ kevin maguire ) private failure circle says it ca n't make a profit out of hinchingbrooke hospital so wants out from a 10-year nhs contract !
ryan bourne ( @ mrrbourne ) circle does n't think can operate in current structure - will leave market .
medway nhs hospital clearly been failing for years - still there .
michaelwhite ( @ michaelwhite ) flashy circle admits defeat on its hinchingbrooke hospital contract .
backs my theory that private sector will fail more than succeed in nhs
today 's data highlights a broader trend ; the eurozone 's factories are producing rather less than before the financial crisis struck more than six years ago .

this chart from nordea markets ' euro economist holger sande plots the industrial production of the major eurozone countries , ( where 100 is their respective level in 2008 ) : holger sandte ( @ holgersandte ) industrial production # us vs # eurozone countries : what a gap .
on an annual basis , french industrial production was 2.6 % lower in november than a year earlier .
matt truman ( @ matttrumantc ) german and french industrial production down , very few reasons to wake up bullish for 2015 's underlying economy

documents.title: french industrial production falls
text: oh dear .
france has matched germany with its own drop in factory output .
french industrial production shrank by 0.3 % month-on-month in november , dashing hopes of a 0.3 % rise .

the narrower measure of manufacturing output was worse , dropping by 0.6 % steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) more dire french data i/p -0.3 % m/m v 0.3 % expected mfg -0.6 % v +0.6 % expected stelios ( @ bbki2611 ) german and french ip both negative .
yep , the euro project sure is working like a charm it suggests france 's economy continues to struggle , after several years of meagre growth or stagnation have pushed unemployment to record highs .
forex news¢ ( @ worldforexnews ) french industrial production nov mm -0.3 % vs +0.3 % exp

documents.title: ing : germany is still counting its bruises
text: carsten brzeski of ing has blamed geopolitical tensions and eurozone stagnation for the drop in germany exports and industrial production .
today 's data provides further evidence that the german economy has not yet fully recovered from the soft spell of the summer .
in fact , the german economy still counts its bruises .
nevertheless , in our view , the economy should gain more momentum in the coming months , benefitting from its very special stimulus package which almost came for free .
the sharp drop in energy prices and the weaker euro exchange rate are without any doubt a blessing for the economy .

documents.title: german economy stutters in november
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the world economy , business and the eurozone .
the day has begun with some downbeat economic news from germany .
industrial output across europe 's largest economy fell by 0.1 % in november , rather weaker than the 0.4 % increase expected by economists .
germany 's finance ministry blamed weaker construction activity , down 0.6 % , and a 2.5 % tumble in energy production .
on the upside , october 's figure was revised up .
but , it still means germany 's factories are producing 0.5 % less than a year ago .
jeroen blokland ( @ jsblokland ) german industrial production unexpectedly falls in november .
megan greene ( @ economistmeg ) german industrial production down by 0.5 % yoy .
this whole asymmetric adjustment approach not working for anyone .
and in a second blow , separate data shows german exports fell for the second month running , down 2.1 % in november .
imports were up 1.5 % , helping to narrow germany 's trade surplus .
that indicates germany is feeling the impact of the weak european economy , hitting demand for its products .
i 'll pull some expert reaction together now .
did britain 's factories do better ?
we find out at 9.30am , when the latest uk industrial production and trade data is released .
french industrial production is due soon .
the main economic data of the day , the us non-farm payroll , is due at 1.30pm gmt .
it is expected to show that another 240,000 or so new jobs were created across the american economy in december .
while the stock markets are expected to be calm , after yesterday 's burst of optimism sent shares rallying across europe .
traders are still anticipating fresh stimulus measures from the european central bank , while fretting about the greek election in a couple of week 's time .
then at 3pm , the niesr thinktank publishes its estimate of uk growth in the last three months of 2014 .
i 'll be tracking all the main events through the day

Best year for job creation since 1999
